channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump holds first-ever White House meeting with Syrian leader
item.description: President Trump is meeting on Monday at the White House with Syrian President Ahmad al-Sharaa , the White House said. Why it matters: This is the firs...

item.title: Trump administration's 50-year mortgage idea ditches a key advantage
item.description: Data: Axios research; Note: Mortgage rate assumptions are 5.5% for 15-year, 6.2% for 30-year, and 6.9% for 50-year; Chart: Sara Wise/Axios The Trump a...

item.title: Jeffries is standing behind Schumer despite Democrats' shutdown fury
item.description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.) said Monday he is standing behind his Senate counterpart, Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.), despite a surge of gr...

item.title: Here's why Congressional Democrats are furious over the shutdown deal
item.description: Many congressional Democrats aren't on board with the Senate deal that could reopen the government after a historically long shutdown. Why it matters:...

item.title: Which Senate Democrats voted to end the shutdown?
item.description: Seven Senate Democrats and one independent broke ranks Sunday night, handing Republicans a 60–40 vote to advance a deal to end the record 40-day shutd...

item.title: Supreme Court to decide if mail-in ballots may arrive after Election Day
item.description: An appeals court found that federal law requires all ballots be received by Election Day.

item.title: Trump administration wants Supreme Court to intervene in SNAP fight again
item.description: The battle over funding for the nation’s largest anti-hunger program has left millions wondering how they will afford food.

item.title: U.S. strikes two more alleged drug boats, pushing death toll past 75
item.description: The attacks in the eastern Pacific Ocean, disclosed Monday by Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, killed six people, he said.

item.title: Trump pardons Giuliani, other allies who sought to overturn 2020 election
item.description: None of the more than 75 people listed have been charged with federal crimes, though several have been prosecuted in states.

item.title: Supreme Court won’t hear challenge to landmark gay marriage ruling
item.description: The announcement indicates there is not an appetite among the high court’s conservative majority to revisit one of the court’s most significant decisi...

item.title: Trump, stung by Republican losses, stands his ground on affordability
item.description: Democrats running on cost-of-living anxieties outperformed Republicans in Tuesday’s elections by greater-than-expected margins. The president chalked ...

item.title: Voters on Tuesday rewarded Democrats who addressed economic costs. Hours later, Trump said he delivered an 'economic miracle.'
item.description: A recent poll found a majority of Americans feel they’re spending more on groceries than they did a year ago.

item.title: Reaganomics in Jersey: Jack Ciattarelli has a supply-side dream if he’s elected governor this week
item.description: The Republican nominee has promised tax cuts and economic growth, but the numbers are fuzzy.

item.title: Trump's approval holds steady despite unpopular policies, per new NYT poll
item.description: Trump’s strength with Republicans on the economy could prove to be a boon for the GOP.

item.title: New poll reveals warning signs for Trump with Latino voters
item.description: A survey from the liberal-leaning group Somos Votantes shows Latino voters are souring on the president.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
